main event: An orange-red ball of fire was observed maneuvering and oscillating horizontally in Cleveland, Ohio, on August 20-21, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as disc-shaped and observed for about 3 minutes., Witnesses reported it moving in circular and elliptical courses., The object was compared in size to a medium-sized airplane., The sighting was documented in the Project Blue Book records., Multiple possible explanations (balloon, aircraft, astronomical, atmospheric) were noted but data was insufficient for conclusive evaluation.
witness description: A civilian driver who observed the object hovering above the trees.
